choices.text: Direct coupling injury
Insulator defect injury
Capacitance coupling injury
Earth plate defect of the diathermy

questions.text: Mrs Rama, 40 years female operated for Fibroid uterus- by laparoscopic method was discharged on 3rd POD. She presents to hospital on 5th POD with diffuse guarding and rigidity all over the abdomen. On CECT abdomen, diffuse collection of fluid seen inside and the radiologist gave a suspicion of bowel leak. During surgery the metal needle holder was touching the bowel and we have touched the needle holder using a monopolar diathermy. What would have been the possibility for the bowel leak which have happened in this case based on the above statement?

choices.text: Catheter related sepsis is a common cause and happens mostly due to frequent manipulation of catheter.
Recent method to confirm catheter sepsis is to do blood sample aspirate for organisms in both central and peripheral veins
Colony count from withdrawal blood from Central vein if more than 5 times that of peripheral blood it's confirmed
Same catheter can be used after giving antibiotics as per culture sensitivity report in cases of confirmed catheter sepsis.

questions.text: Mr Kumar 25 years male operated for mesenteric trauma- around 400 cm of small bowel was removed 1 week back . He came to hospital now with severe Diarrhoea, steatorrhea and Hyperacidity. He was planned for TPN and the cannulation was done via the subclavian vein. After 30 days of TPN patient has fever. Which of the following statement is false on this case?

choices.text: BMI- 39
Surgery planned has an expected time < 2 hours
Journey time from home is 2 hours
No upper limit for age- can be done at any age

questions.text: Mr kumar was planned for Day case surgery. Which of the following factor given below will make him unfit for Day care surgery?
questions.solution:
Points from Bailey

  • BP < 180/110 need not be cancelled from Day care list
  • Hba1c < 8.5% is good control
  • Epilepsy is not a contraindication for surgery- but don't omit the tablets preoperatively
  • BMI upto 40 for Surface procedures, upto 38 for laparoscopic procedures are acceptable
  • Travel Time < 1 hour
  • Surgery Time < 2 Hours

choices.text: Blood pressure < 70 mmHg
Serum Lactate > 5 mmol/l
Blood transfusion around 15 units
ISS < 36

questions.text: Mr Gupta 30 years male faced a massive road traffic accident and was admitted in ICU for multiple fractures. He was planned for Damage Control Surgery based on the following facts. Which among the following parameter is not an indication for Damage control surgery?
questions.solution:
5 Stages of DCS

  • 1- Identify the patient
  • 2- Emergency OT
  • 3- ICU care
  • 4- Elective repairs
  • 5- Closure of abdomen

choices.text: Urine dipstick may be used in the absence of laboratory facilities from the aspirated fluid
In a penetrating trauma > 10000 RBC is said to be positive
FAST cannot detect < 100 ml fluid in peritoneal cavity
Retroperitoneal injuries cannot be detected by E FAST but can be detected by DPL

questions.text: Regarding Diagnostic peritoneal lavage and FAST - False statement is:
questions.solution:
DPL is positive in Blunt Trauma

  • > 1 lakh RBC/ml
  • >500 WBC/ml
  • Raised amylase+
  • Bilirubin+
  • Vegetable materials/food particles+

In penetrating Trauma 1/10th of above value is positive.

choices.text: Zone 1
Zone 2
Zone 3
Zone 4

questions.text: A patient had a Blunt trauma and presented with Retroperitoneal Hematoma. Which of the injuries shown in the image you must never try to operate and plan only non-operative treatments in most situations

choices.text: Short Tau Inversion Recovery MRI ( STIR) is done after tissue biopsy
In case of Bony invasion CT scan is advised
Tissue diagnosis is made with Incisional Biopsy
USG guided FNAC of the node has no evidence of tumour seedling in the tract

questions.text: Mr Kunal Gupta, 50 years old male , severe betelnut chewer presents with a painless ulcer in the tongue and a swelling in the left side neck. On examination of the swelling and ulcer- Ulcer is 3X2 cm size, Swelling is solitary and found to be a node 3X2 cm size. On evaluation of this patient - Which of the following statement is false?

choices.text: Associated with MEN 1 syndrome
Mc site for metastasis is Lungs
Lymph node involvement is seen in 50% cases
Tumor is TSH dependent and shows increased RAIU

questions.text: Mrs kumari, 25 years female presents with thyroid swelling with complaints of diarrhea. On evaluation, she gives history of her mother expired due to some cancer inside the abdomen. Now on evaluation of this girl - FNAC showed. What is TRUE statement from given below?
questions.solution:
Features of Medullary cancer

  • Diarrhoea is a feature in 30% of cases and this may be due to 5-hydroxy tryptamine or prostaglandins produced by the tumour cells.
  • Familial type - 20% and seen in children and young girls
  • Sporadic form has no sex predominance and occur at any age.
  • 50-60% have Lymphnode metastasis
  • MC site of distant mets is to liver
  • The tumor is not TSH dependent and not takes up RAIU**

choices.text: Opposite Breast must be always evaluated for cancer by FNAC under MRI guidance.
The patient must be advised to take Tamoxifen in post op period
Breast conservative surgery is contraindicated for this patient
Ideal treatment for this case will be Bilateral MRM + Trastuzumab therapy.

questions.text: 45 years old Obese premenopausal women Mrs Rani presents to your breast clinic. On routine Mammography you found she is having a 5X4 cm lesion in right breast. Clinical examination also revealed she is having multiple axillary nodes fixed to each other. Trucut biopsy taken from the lesion shows Lobular carcinoma Breast. Immunohistochemistry was done - ER negative, PR negative and HER 2 was positive. Which of the following statement is wrong regarding this case?
questions.solution:
Lobular carcinoma Breast

  • Less than 10% of Breast cancers
  • Multicentric and Multifocal cancer with Bilateral involvement
  • Indian file pattern seen on FNAC
  • Mammography may not show any finding
  • Advised to undergo bilateral MRI breast to find tumors which may be multicentric.
  • Bilateral MRM is the treatment done.

choices.text: False positive MIBI scan is associated with Hurthle cell adenomas and hence Tc 99m Subtraction images obtained
Discordancy in images is further evaluated by 4D CT scan.
Minimally invasive parathyroidectomy with a small incision of 3 cm is enough for this patient and no further evaluation needed if images are concordant
Bilateral neck exploration and removal of all glands with leaving of inferior 1 gland is preferred with a marking non absorbable suture Ans C

questions.text: Mr Ramu 25 years male with manic depressive illness presented with multiple renal stones and pancreatic stones. He was evaluated by USG neck showed a nodule in left inferior parathyroid gland. Sestamibi scan showed another nodule in upper part of neck along with left inferior parathyroid adenoma. We are planning to do surgery. Which is false statement from given below?
questions.solution:
Minimally Invasive parathyroidectomy Miami Criteria

  • Incision < 3cm
  • Intra op PTH measurement.
  • Half life of PTH is 3-5 minutes and hence there should be drop to less than half the preop value in 10 minutes after removal .
  • If there is no drop we must do Bilateral Cervical Exploration

choices.text: There will be severe rigidity in the abdomen
Contrast CT is always required to guide management
T tube drainage of esophagus with feeding jejunostomy is done in cases of late presentations with severe contamination.
Selected patients can be managed by Non operative treatment.

questions.text: Mr Solomon, A dutch fleet - is a Glutton used to induce autoemesis. One day while he autoemeted Professor Boerhaave noted he is having severe pain in his chest and breathlessness. He was evaluated. False statement regarding this case is:

choices.text: Rapid gastric emptying is a common feature of early and late dumping
Early dumping is seen in patients after High selective vagotomy also
Somatostatin is useful for Diarrhea which develops in Dumping syndrome
Revisional procedure of choice is antrectomy + Roux en Y reconstruction

questions.text: False statement regarding Dumping syndrome after peptic ulcer surgery is:
questions.solution:
Treatment of Dumping

  • High fat and protein diet- Reduced carbohydrate diet
  • Small regular meals advised
  • Octreotide or other long acting analogues may be helpful but not prevent the diarrhea**
  • Revisional surgery with Antrectomy and RYGJ is done is procedure of choice at non responding cases.
  • Octreotide is very effective for late dumping syndrome

choices.text: Age >45
BMI>50
Female gender
Hypertension

questions.text: Obesity Surgery- Mortality risk scores ( OS-MRS) predict the prognosis of the patient after surgery gives one point for the following factors except
questions.solution:
Factors of OS- MRS

  • Age > 45
  • BMI>50
  • Male patient ( Central obesity)
  • Hypertension ( Central Obesity)
  • Increased risk of DVT/PE

Give 1 point for each. Increased points has increased risk

Obstructive sleep apnea is a risk for Anastomotic leak

Uncontrolled Diabetes is also a risk factor

choices.text: Adenoma
FNH
Hemangioma
HCC

questions.text: Mrs Kamala 50 years female with History of OCP intake presents with abdominal pain. CECT abdomen done is shown in the image
questions.solution:
FNH

  • Only tumor in liver to have functioning RES ( Kupffer cells)
  • So it is the only tumor which takes up Sulphur colloid SCAN
  • Bailey Says- MRI using liver specific contrast agent- SUPERMAGENTIC IRON OXIDE which is taken by Kupffer cells may be useful in determining the Hepatocellular origin.

HCC

choices.text: HIDA scan is helpful to confirm the leak or Biliary obstruction
ERCP if available is the best to diagnose Bile leak
MRCP may also help us to determine the level of injury
CECT abdomen is always done post surgery as a part of follow up in Bile duct injury.

questions.text: Mrs Rani who had a laparoscopic cholecystectomy 2 days back is now presenting with right hypochondrial pain and fever. Urgent USG abdomen revealed Collection of 10 cm in right hypochondrium. Urgent PCD done and patient is observed in ward. Which of the following is not a part of further management:
questions.solution: Strassberg classification in MRCP

choices.text: Percutaneous drainage of the infected fluid must be drained by wide bore PCD tube
If sepsis worsens Pancreatic necrosectomy is advised
If the head is involved a retroperitoneal left flank approach is advised.
Beger advised continuous lavage of lesser sac

questions.text: Mr Somu 25 years alcoholic male was admitted in ICU for severe acute pancreatitis- CECT abdomen was taken on 4th day of admission is shown here. Which of the following is not a part of his management now?
questions.solution:
Pancreatic Necrosectomy

  • If the sepsis worsens despite this, then a pancreatic necrosectomy should be considered.
  • The surgical approach may be through a mid-line laparotomy, especially if the area involved is around the head of the gland.
  • If the body and tail of the gland are primarily involved a retroperitoneal approach through a left flank incision may be more appropriate.
  • Blunt dissection is preferable to sharp dissection.
  • A rigid laparoscope is inserted into the peripancreatic area through a retroperitoneal approach, and vigorous irrigation and suction is combined with a gradual nibbling away of the necrotic debris

Associated steps we do while dissecting

  • Feeding jejunostomy
  • If gallstones are the precipitating factor of the pancreatitis, a cholecystectomy should be included.
  • Closed Continuous lavage of Beger
  • Closed Drainage
  • Open packing and repacking every 72 hours - Incision is left opened
  • Closure and relaparotomy every 48-72 hours

choices.text: After conclusion of procedure a nephrostomy tube is left in kidney for 24/48 hours
This is the ideal procedure to treat patients with Calyceal diverticular stones
Hemorrhage from renal vessels may need an open surgery to repair the renal artery
Injury to colon is a complication seen in subcostal approach

questions.text: Mr Mishra khan 40 years male presented to us with a stone in renal pelvis- size 2.5 cm. The stone is planned to be removed by Percutaneous nephrolithotomy. Surgery done successfully. Regarding PCNL procedure and complications- wrong statement is:
questions.solution:
PCNL

  • ESWL is suitable only for sizes upto 1.5cm
  • ESWL is not possible in Obstructed system, Obese patients, pregnant patients and patients on oral anti coagulation or bleeding diathesis
  • PCNL is therefore best for above cases and for PUJ obstruction, Calyceal diverticula or in presence of ureteric obstruction.
  • PCNL is ideal for Struvite infected stones which needs complete removal
  • PCNL is good for hard stones like Cystine and Calcium oxalate monohydrate stones.


Nephroscope

choices.text: 1-f , 2- e, 3- d, 4- a
1-d,2-c,3-e, 4-c
1-f, 2-e, 3-a, 4-d
1-c, 2-d, 3-e, 4- b

questions.text: Mr Ganesan 70 years male underwent TURP in a urology department in a Government hospital. Identify the correct match
questions.solution:
Laser treatment for BOO


Holmium Laser enucleation of prostate

choices.text: EVLA can ablate any size of vein with low rate of recanalization.
RFA is best for Tortuous veins and perforators
RFA is more costly compared to EVLA
Tessari method is used for Foam Sclerotherapy

questions.text: False statement given below related to Varicose Vein management by recent advances

choices.text: Rotational flap- Bipedicle flap- Bilobed flap- Transposition flap
Transposition flap- Bilobed flap-Bipedicle flap- Rotational flap
Limberg flap- Bucket handle flap- Transposition flap- Bilobed flap
Transposition flap- Bucket handle- W advancement flap- Moh's graft
